scope.goal: Develop a modern, responsive landing page for TaskMaster Pro to showcase its project management capabilities for remote teams struggling with coordination and visibility. The page will highlight key features, pricing options, and testimonials to drive user sign-ups and conversions. This addresses the pain point of fragmented communication in distributed teams by presenting a unified, intuitive tool overview.

tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14+ App Router + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS + Shadcn/ui

features: Hero section with compelling headline, subheadline, purple/blue gradient background, and primary CTA button for sign-up/demo request
Features grid displaying 6 key features (e.g., task assignment, real-time collaboration, integrations, reporting, mobile access, AI insights) using card components with icons and descriptions
Pricing table with 3 tiers (Free: basic tasks; Pro: advanced collaboration $19/mo; Enterprise: custom support $99/mo) including feature comparisons and upgrade CTAs
Customer testimonials section with 3-4 quote cards, avatars, and ratings for social proof
Footer with company info, social media links (LinkedIn, Twitter, GitHub), and copyright notice
Responsive design ensuring mobile-first layout with Tailwind breakpoints and purple/blue gradient theme throughout
comps: Trello (strength: visual boards; gap: lacks advanced reporting for enterprise remote teams)
Asana (strength: workflow automation; gap: pricing complexity overwhelms small remote teams)
Monday.com (strength: customizable dashboards; gap: steep learning curve for quick onboarding)
scope.outcome: Live repo on localhost:3000 + Vercel URL + 80% test coverage

in_scope: Query UI component database for buttons, cards, tables, and testimonials
Design responsive layout with purple/blue gradients using Tailwind
Implementation of all sections with Next.js and Shadcn/ui components
out_scope: Full SaaS application backend or user authentication
SEO optimization beyond basic meta tags
milestones: M1: Research UI components and competitor analysis done
M2: Design specs and wireframes with theme finalized
M3: MVP deployed on localhost:3000 and Vercel
risks: Custom components needed if database lacks matches (mitigation: query database first, fallback to Shadcn primitives)
Theme consistency issues (mitigation: define Tailwind config early)
kpis: Fully responsive on mobile/desktop (Lighthouse mobile score 90+)
CTA conversion tracking setup (e.g., via Google Analytics)
